title: Asia Naphtha/Gasoline-Naphtha slips; gasoline nears 2-month high
text:
Asia Naphtha/Gasoline-Naphtha slips; gasoline nears 2-month high

SINGAPORE, Sept 12 (Reuters) - Asia's naphtha crack eased 8 cents to a four-session low of $22.60 a tonne on Thursday as abundant supplies persisted.

- This was reflected in this week's deal in which Formosa Petrochemical Corp locked in about 100,000 tonnes of open-specification naphtha for second-half October arrival at Mailiao at a discount within the $2 to $3 a tonne level to its own price formula on a cost-and-freight (C&F) basis.

- Although discounts were narrower compared to the discount levels between $4 and $5 Formosa had recently paid for first-half October cargoes, prices remained at discounts due to oversupply, industry sources said.

* CRACKER NEWS: Japanese Keiyo Ethylene's cracker output has been affected by a typhoon but the exact run rates were not disclosed.

- Keiyo Ethylene, which operates a 768,000 tonnes per year (tpy) cracker, is owned by Maruzen and Sumitomo.

* GASOLINE: Asia's gasoline crack jumped 13.5 percent or 94 cents to reach a near 2-month high of $7.88 a barrel as inventories eased on demand.

- Singapore's onshore light distillates inventories edged down by 1.13 percent or 128,000 barrels to reach a three-week low of 11.157 million barrels in the week to Wednesday, data from Enterprise Singapore showed. O/SING1

- This mirrored the trend in the United States where its gasoline stocks fell 682,000 barrels last week, data from the Energy Information Administration (EIA) showed. TENDERS: Indonesia's Pertamina had sealed a quarterly tender to buy gasoline for October to December delivery at discounts slightly above $1 a barrel to Singapore quotes on a free-on-board (FOB) basis.

- The total volumes concluded were unclear but Pertamina was originally seeking from 100,000 to 250,000 barrels per month of 88-octane grade gasoline a month for the fourth quarter.

- Pertamina, also Asia's top gasoline importer, has an outstanding tender to buy gasoline from the spot market. MOG/TENDA

- India's BPCL in the meantime is looking to buy 40,000 tonnes of gasoline for September to October arrival at Kandla through a tender due to be awarded on Sept. 16.

- BPCL has already bought more 110,000 tonnes of gasoline from the spot market this year for March to September arrival at Mumbai, Kandla and Kochi. MOG/TENDA

- Similarly, India's HPCL is also looking to buy gasoline through a tender due to be awarded on Sept. 16.

- HPCL has however sold 30,000 tonnes of gasoline for Sept. 25-27 loading from Vizag to Trafigura although this could not be independently confirmed.

* CASH DEALS: Seven gasoline trades and two on naphtha. O/AS

Table below shows some of the maintenance taking place in September. For more information, go to REF/A IOC/Panipat
